methods.name: isEffect
methods.desc: Returns whether the strike is an effect that does no damage.
methods.ret: whether the strike is an effect

methods.name: getFlashes
methods.desc:
Get the amount of flashes that will occur before the lightning is
removed. By default this value is between 1 and 3.

methods.name: setFlashes
methods.desc:
Set the amount of flashes that will occur before the lightning is
removed. One flash will occur after this lightning strike's life
has reduced below 0.

methods.name: getLifeTicks
methods.desc:
Get the amount of ticks this lightning strike will inflict damage upon its hit entities.

When life ticks are negative, there is a random chance that another flash will be initiated and life ticks reset to 1.

methods.name: setLifeTicks
methods.desc:
Get the amount of ticks this lightning strike will inflict damage upon its hit entities.

When life ticks are negative, there is a random chance that another flash will be initiated and life ticks reset to 1. Additionally, if life ticks are set to 2 (the default value when a lightning strike has been spawned), a list of events will occur:

  • Impact sound effects will be played
  • Fire will be spawned (dependent on difficulty)
  • Lightning rods will be powered (if hit)
  • Copper will be stripped (if hit)
  • {@link GameEvent#LIGHTNING_STRIKE} will be dispatched

methods.name: getCausingPlayer
methods.desc:
Get the {@link Player} that caused this lightning to strike. This
will occur naturally if a trident enchanted with
{@link Enchantment#CHANNELING Channeling} were thrown at an entity
during a storm.

methods.name: setCausingPlayer
methods.desc: Set the {@link Player} that caused this lightning to strike.

methods.name: getFlashCount
methods.desc: Returns the amount of flash iterations that will be done before the lightning dies.
methods.ret: amount of flashes that will be shown before the lightning dies

methods.name: setFlashCount

params.name: flashes
params.desc: amount of iterations that will be done before the lightning dies, must to be a positive number

methods.desc:
Sets the amount of life iterations that will be done before the lightning dies.
Default number of flashes on creation is between 1-3.

methods.name: getCausingEntity
methods.desc:
Returns the potential entity that caused this lightning strike to spawn in the world.

As of implementing this method, only {@link Player}s are capable of causing a lightning strike, however as this might change in future minecraft releases, this method does not guarantee a player as the cause of a lightning. Consumers of this method should hence validate whether or not the entity is a player if they want to use player specific methods through an {@code instanceOf} check.

A player is, as of implementing this method, responsible for a lightning, and will hence be returned here as a cause, if they channeled a {@link Trident} to summon it or were explicitly defined as the cause of this lightning through {@link #setCausingPlayer(Player)}.
methods.ret:
the entity that caused this lightning or null if the lightning was not caused by a entity (e.g. normal
weather)

desc: Represents an instance of a lightning strike. May or may not do damage.

methods.name: setFuseTicks
methods.desc: Set the number of ticks until the TNT blows up after being primed.

methods.desc:
Retrieve the number of ticks until the explosion of this TNTPrimed

methods.ret: the number of ticks until this TNTPrimed explodes

methods.name: getSource
methods.desc:
Gets the source of this primed TNT. The source is the entity responsible for the creation of this primed TNT. (I.E. player ignites TNT with flint and steel.) Take note that this can be null if there is no suitable source. (created by the {@link org.bukkit.World#spawn(Location, Class)} method, for example.)

The source will become null if the chunk this primed TNT is in is unloaded then reloaded. The source entity may be invalid if for example it has since died or been unloaded. Callers should check {@link Entity#isValid()}.
methods.ret: the source of this primed TNT

methods.name: setSource

params.name: source
params.desc: the source of this primed TNT

methods.desc:
Sets the source of this primed TNT. The source is the entity responsible for the creation of this primed TNT.

Must be instance of {@link org.bukkit.entity.LivingEntity} otherwise will be set to null. The parameter is typed {@link org.bukkit.entity.Entity} to be consistent with {@link org.bukkit.entity.TNTPrimed#getSource()} method.

methods.name: getSourceLoc
methods.desc: Gets the source block location of the TNTPrimed
methods.ret: the source block location the TNTPrimed was spawned from

methods.name: setBlockData
methods.desc:
Sets the visual block data of this primed tnt.
The explosion of the tnt stays the same and is not affected by this change.

methods.name: getBlockData
methods.desc:
Gets the visual block data of this
primed tnt.

desc: Represents a Primed TNT.

methods.name: teleport
methods.desc:
Randomly teleports the Enderman in a 64x64x64 block cuboid region.

If the randomly selected point is in the ground, the point is moved 1 block down until air is found or until it goes under {@link org.bukkit.World#getMinHeight()}.

This method will return false if this Enderman is not alive, or if the teleport location was obstructed, or if the teleport location is in water.

methods.name: teleportTowards
methods.desc:
Randomly teleports the Enderman towards the given entity.

The point is selected by drawing a vector between this enderman and the given entity. That vector's length is set to 16 blocks. That point is then moved within a 8x8x8 cuboid region. If the randomly selected point is in the ground, the point is moved 1 block down until air is found or until it goes under {@link org.bukkit.World#getMinHeight()}.

This method will return false if this Enderman is not alive, or if the teleport location was obstructed, or if the teleport location is in water.

methods.name: getAmbientSound
methods.desc:
Get the {@link Sound} this mob makes while ambiently existing. This sound
may change depending on the current state of the entity, and may also
return null under specific conditions. This sound is not constant.

on whether or not they are actively trading with a player, or make no

methods.name: breakBlock
methods.desc:
Force this player to break a Block using the item in their main hand. This method will respect enchantments, handle item durability (if applicable) and drop experience and the correct items according to the tool/item in the player's hand.

Note that this method will call a {@link BlockBreakEvent}, meaning that this method may not be successful in breaking the block if the event was cancelled by a third party plugin. Care should be taken if running this method in a BlockBreakEvent listener as recursion may be possible if it is invoked on the same {@link Block} being broken in the event.

Additionally, a {@link BlockDropItemEvent} is called for the items dropped by this method (if successful).

The block must be in the same world as the player.
methods.ret: true if the block was broken, false if the break failed

methods.desc:
Send a block change. This fakes a block change packet for a user at a
certain location. This will not actually change the world in any way.

methods.name: sendBlockChanges

params.name: blocks
params.desc: the block states to send to the player

methods.desc:
Send a multi-block change. This fakes a block change packet for a user at multiple locations. This will not actually change the world in any way.

This method may send multiple packets to the client depending on the blocks in the collection. A packet must be sent for each chunk section modified, meaning one packet for each 16x16x16 block area. Even if only one block is changed in two different chunk sections, two packets will be sent.

Additionally, this method cannot guarantee the functionality of changes being sent to the player in chunks not loaded by the client. It is the responsibility of the caller to ensure that the client is within range of the changed blocks or to handle any side effects caused as a result.

Send a sign change. This fakes a sign change packet for a user at a certain location. This will not actually change the world in any way. This method will use a sign at the location's block or a faked sign sent via {@link #sendBlockChange(org.bukkit.Location, org.bukkit.block.data.BlockData)}.

If the client does not have a sign at the given location it will display an error message to the user.

To change all attributes of a sign, including the back Side, use {@link #sendBlockUpdate(org.bukkit.Location, org.bukkit.block.TileState)}.

methods.name: sendBlockUpdate
methods.desc:
Send a TileState change. This fakes a TileState change for a user at the given location. This will not actually change the world in any way. This method will use a TileState at the location's block or a faked TileState sent via {@link #sendBlockChange(org.bukkit.Location, org.bukkit.block.data.BlockData)}.

If the client does not have an appropriate tile at the given location it may display an error message to the user.

{@link BlockData#createBlockState()} can be used to create a {@link BlockState}.

methods.name: sendPotionEffectChange

params.name: entity
params.desc: the entity whose potion effects to change

methods.desc:
Change a potion effect for the target entity. This will not actually change the entity's potion effects in any way.

Note: Sending an effect change to a player for themselves may cause unexpected behavior on the client. Effects sent this way will also not be removed when their timer reaches 0, they can be removed with {@link #sendPotionEffectChangeRemove(LivingEntity, PotionEffectType)}

methods.name: sendPotionEffectChangeRemove

params.name: entity
params.desc: the entity whose potion effects to change

methods.desc:
Remove a potion effect for the target entity. This will not actually change the entity's potion effects in any way.

Note: Sending an effect change to a player for themselves may cause unexpected behavior on the client.

methods.name: sendMap
methods.desc:
Render a map and send it to the player in its entirety. This may be
used when streaming the map in the normal manner is not desirable.

methods.name: showWinScreen
methods.desc:
Shows the player the win screen that normally is only displayed after one kills the ender dragon and exits the end for the first time. In vanilla, the win screen starts with a poem and then continues with the credits but its content can be changed by using a resource pack.
Calling this method does not change the value of {@link #hasSeenWinScreen()}. That means that the win screen is still displayed to a player if they leave the end for the first time, even though they have seen it before because this method was called. Note this method does not make the player invulnerable, which is normally expected when viewing credits.

methods.name: hasSeenWinScreen
methods.desc:
Returns whether this player has seen the win screen before.
When a player leaves the end the win screen is shown to them if they have not seen it before.
methods.ret: Whether this player has seen the win screen before

methods.name: setHasSeenWinScreen

params.name: hasSeenWinScreen
params.desc: Whether this player has seen the win screen before

methods.desc:
Changes whether this player has seen the win screen before.
When a player leaves the end the win screen is shown to them if they have not seen it before.

the yaw in degrees relative to the player's direction where 0

methods.name: addCustomChatCompletions
methods.desc:
Add custom chat completion suggestions shown to the player while typing a
message.

methods.name: removeCustomChatCompletions
methods.desc:
Remove custom chat completion suggestions shown to the player while
typing a message.

Online player names cannot be removed with this method. This will affect
only custom completions added by {@link #addCustomChatCompletions(Collection)}
or {@link #setCustomChatCompletions(Collection)}.

methods.name: setCustomChatCompletions
methods.desc:
Set the list of chat completion suggestions shown to the player while typing a message.

If completions were set previously, this method will remove them all and replace them with the provided completions.

methods.name: getPreviousGameMode
methods.desc: Gets this player's previous {@link GameMode}

methods.name: setPlayerTime

params.name: time
params.desc:
The current player's perceived time or the player's time
    offset from the server time.

params.name: relative
params.desc:
When true the player time is kept relative to its world
    time.

methods.desc:
Sets the current time on the player's client. When relative is true the player's time will be kept synchronized to its world time with the specified offset.

When using non relative time the player's time will stay fixed at the specified time parameter. It's up to the caller to continue updating the player's time. To restore player time to normal use resetPlayerTime().

methods.name: getPlayerTime
methods.desc: Returns the player's current timestamp.

methods.name: getPlayerTimeOffset
methods.desc:
Returns the player's current time offset relative to server time, or
the current player's fixed time if the player's time is absolute.

methods.name: isPlayerTimeRelative
methods.desc:
Returns true if the player's time is relative to the server time,
otherwise the player's time is absolute and will not change its current
time unless done so with setPlayerTime().
methods.ret: true if the player's time is relative to the server time.

methods.name: resetPlayerTime
methods.desc:
Restores the normal condition where the player's time is synchronized with the server time.

Equivalent to calling setPlayerTime(0, true).

methods.name: setPlayerWeather

params.name: type
params.desc: The WeatherType enum type the player should experience

methods.desc:
Sets the type of weather the player will see.  When used, the weather
status of the player is locked until {@link #resetPlayerWeather()} is
used.

methods.name: getPlayerWeather
methods.desc: Returns the type of weather the player is currently experiencing.
methods.ret:
The WeatherType that the player is currently experiencing or
    null if player is seeing server weather.

methods.name: resetPlayerWeather
methods.desc:
Restores the normal condition where the player's weather is controlled
by server conditions.

methods.name: giveExp
methods.desc: Gives the player the amount of experience specified.

methods.name: getExpCooldown
methods.desc: Gets the player's cooldown between picking up experience orbs.

methods.name: setExpCooldown
methods.desc: Sets the player's cooldown between picking up experience orbs.. Note: Setting this to 0 allows the player to pick up instantly, but setting this to a negative value will cause the player to be unable to pick up xp-orbs. Calling this Method will result in {@link PlayerExpCooldownChangeEvent} being called.

methods.name: giveExp

params.name: applyMending
params.desc: Mend players items with mending, with same behavior as picking up orbs. calls {@link #applyMending(int)}

methods.desc: Gives the player the amount of experience specified.

methods.name: applyMending
methods.desc:
Applies the mending effect to any items just as picking up an orb would.

Can also be called with {@link #giveExp(int, boolean)} by passing true to applyMending

methods.name: giveExpLevels

params.name: amount
params.desc: amount of experience levels to give or take

methods.desc:
Gives the player the amount of experience levels specified. Levels can
be taken by specifying a negative amount.

methods.name: getExp
methods.desc:
Gets the players current experience points towards the next level.

This is a percentage value. 0 is "no progress" and 1 is "next level".

methods.name: setExp
methods.desc:
Sets the players current experience points towards the next level

This is a percentage value. 0 is "no progress" and 1 is "next level".

methods.name: getLevel
methods.desc: Gets the players current experience level

methods.name: setLevel
methods.desc: Sets the players current experience level

methods.name: getTotalExperience
methods.desc:
Gets the players total experience points.
This refers to the total amount of experience the player has collected over time and is not currently displayed to the client.

methods.name: setTotalExperience
methods.desc:
Sets the players current experience points.
This refers to the total amount of experience the player has collected over time and is not currently displayed to the client.

methods.name: calculateTotalExperiencePoints
methods.desc:
Gets the players total amount of experience points he collected to reach the current level and level progress.

This method differs from {@link #getTotalExperience()} in that this method always returns an up-to-date value that reflects the players{@link #getLevel() level} and {@link #getExp() level progress}

methods.name: setExperienceLevelAndProgress
methods.desc:
Updates the players level and level progress to that what would be reached when the total amount of experience had been collected.

This method differs from {@link #setTotalExperience(int)} in that this method actually updates the {@link #getLevel() level} and {@link #getExp() level progress} so that a subsequent call of {@link #calculateTotalExperiencePoints()} yields the same amount of points that have been set

methods.name: getExperiencePointsNeededForNextLevel
methods.desc:
Gets the total amount of experience points that are needed to reach the next level from zero progress towards it.

Can be used with {@link #getExp()} to calculate the current points for the current level and alike

methods.name: sendExperienceChange
methods.desc:
Send an experience change.

This fakes an experience change packet for a user. This will not actually
change the experience points in any way.

methods.name: sendExperienceChange
methods.desc:
Send an experience change.

This fakes an experience change packet for a user. This will not actually
change the experience points in any way.

methods.name: getAllowFlight
methods.desc:
Determines if the Player is allowed to fly via jump key double-tap like
in creative mode.
methods.ret: True if the player is allowed to fly.

methods.name: setAllowFlight
methods.desc:
Sets if the Player is allowed to fly via jump key double-tap like in
creative mode.

params.desc: Enables fall damage when {@link #getAllowFlight()} is {@code true}

methods.desc: Allows you to enable fall damage while {@link #getAllowFlight()} is {@code true}

methods.name: hasFlyingFallDamage
methods.desc: Allows you to get if fall damage is enabled while {@link #getAllowFlight()} is {@code true}
methods.ret: A tristate of whether fall damage is enabled, not set, or disabled when {@link #getAllowFlight()} is {@code true}

methods.desc: Allows this player to see a player that was previously hidden

Allows this player to see a player that was previously hidden. If

methods.ret: True if the {@code other} player was listed.

methods.name: listPlayer

methods.name: setFlySpeed
methods.desc:
Sets the speed at which a client will fly. Negative values indicate
reverse directions.

methods.name: setWalkSpeed
methods.desc:
Sets the speed at which a client will walk. Negative values indicate
reverse directions.

methods.name: getWalkSpeed
methods.desc: Gets the current allowed speed that a client can walk.

methods.name: setTexturePack

params.name: url
params.desc:
The URL from which the client will download the texture
    pack. The string must contain only US-ASCII characters and should
    be encoded as per RFC 1738.

methods.desc:
Request that the player's client download and switch texture packs.

The player's client will download the new texture pack asynchronously in the background, and will automatically switch to it once the download is complete. If the client has downloaded and cached the same texture pack in the past, it will perform a file size check against the response content to determine if the texture pack has changed and needs to be downloaded again. When this request is sent for the very first time from a given server, the client will first display a confirmation GUI to the player before proceeding with the download.

Notes:

  • Players can disable server textures on their client, in which case this method will have no affect on them. Use the {@link PlayerResourcePackStatusEvent} to figure out whether or not the player loaded the pack!
  • The request is send with "null" as the hash. This might result in newer versions not loading the pack correctly.

methods.name: setResourcePack

params.name: url
params.desc:
The URL from which the client will download the resource
    pack. The string must contain only US-ASCII characters and should
    be encoded as per RFC 1738.

methods.desc:
Request that the player's client download and switch resource packs.

The player's client will download the new resource pack asynchronously in the background, and will automatically switch to it once the download is complete. If the client has downloaded and cached the same resource pack in the past, it will perform a file size check against the response content to determine if the resource pack has changed and needs to be downloaded again. When this request is sent for the very first time from a given server, the client will first display a confirmation GUI to the player before proceeding with the download.

Notes:

  • Players can disable server resources on their client, in which case this method will have no affect on them. Use the {@link PlayerResourcePackStatusEvent} to figure out whether or not the player loaded the pack!
  • The request is send with empty string as the hash. This might result in newer versions not loading the pack correctly.

methods.name: setResourcePack

params.name: url
params.desc:
The URL from which the client will download the resource
    pack. The string must contain only US-ASCII characters and should
    be encoded as per RFC 1738.

params.name: hash
params.desc:
The sha1 hash sum of the resource pack file which is used
    to apply a cached version of the pack directly without downloading
    if it is available. Hast to be 20 bytes long!

methods.desc:
Request that the player's client download and switch resource packs.

The player's client will download the new resource pack asynchronously in the background, and will automatically switch to it once the download is complete. If the client has downloaded and cached a resource pack with the same hash in the past it will not download but directly apply the cached pack. If the hash is null and the client has downloaded and cached the same resource pack in the past, it will perform a file size check against the response content to determine if the resource pack has changed and needs to be downloaded again. When this request is sent for the very first time from a given server, the client will first display a confirmation GUI to the player before proceeding with the download.

Notes:

  • Players can disable server resources on their client, in which case this method will have no affect on them. Use the {@link PlayerResourcePackStatusEvent} to figure out whether or not the player loaded the pack!
  • The request is sent with empty string as the hash when the hash is not provided. This might result in newer versions not loading the pack correctly.

methods.name: setResourcePack

params.name: url
params.desc:
The URL from which the client will download the resource
    pack. The string must contain only US-ASCII characters and should
    be encoded as per RFC 1738.

params.name: hash
params.desc:
The sha1 hash sum of the resource pack file which is used
    to apply a cached version of the pack directly without downloading
    if it is available. Hast to be 20 bytes long!

params.name: prompt
params.desc: The optional custom prompt message to be shown to client.

methods.desc:
Request that the player's client download and switch resource packs.

The player's client will download the new resource pack asynchronously in the background, and will automatically switch to it once the download is complete. If the client has downloaded and cached a resource pack with the same hash in the past it will not download but directly apply the cached pack. If the hash is null and the client has downloaded and cached the same resource pack in the past, it will perform a file size check against the response content to determine if the resource pack has changed and needs to be downloaded again. When this request is sent for the very first time from a given server, the client will first display a confirmation GUI to the player before proceeding with the download.

Notes:

  • Players can disable server resources on their client, in which case this method will have no affect on them. Use the {@link PlayerResourcePackStatusEvent} to figure out whether or not the player loaded the pack!
  • To remove a resource pack you can use {@link #removeResourcePacks(UUID, UUID...)} or {@link #clearResourcePacks()}.
  • The request is sent with empty string as the hash when the hash is not provided. This might result in newer versions not loading the pack correctly.

  • Players can disable server resources on their client, in which case this method will have no affect on them. Use the {@link PlayerResourcePackStatusEvent} to figure out whether or not the player loaded the pack!
  • To remove a resource pack you can use {@link #removeResourcePacks(UUID, UUID...)} or {@link #clearResourcePacks()}.
  • The request is sent with empty string as the hash when the hash is not provided. This might result in newer versions not loading the pack correctly.

methods.name: setResourcePack

params.name: url
params.desc:
The URL from which the client will download the resource
    pack. The string must contain only US-ASCII characters and should
    be encoded as per RFC 1738.

params.name: hash
params.desc:
The sha1 hash sum of the resource pack file which is used
    to apply a cached version of the pack directly without downloading
    if it is available. Hast to be 20 bytes long!

params.name: prompt
params.desc: The optional custom prompt message to be shown to client.

params.name: force
params.desc:
If true, the client will be disconnected from the server
    when it declines to use the resource pack.

methods.desc:
Request that the player's client download and switch resource packs.

The player's client will download the new resource pack asynchronously in the background, and will automatically switch to it once the download is complete. If the client has downloaded and cached a resource pack with the same hash in the past it will not download but directly apply the cached pack. If the hash is null and the client has downloaded and cached the same resource pack in the past, it will perform a file size check against the response content to determine if the resource pack has changed and needs to be downloaded again. When this request is sent for the very first time from a given server, the client will first display a confirmation GUI to the player before proceeding with the download.

Notes:

  • Players can disable server resources on their client, in which case this method will have no affect on them. Use the {@link PlayerResourcePackStatusEvent} to figure out whether or not the player loaded the pack!
  • To remove a resource pack you can use {@link #removeResourcePacks(UUID, UUID...)} or {@link #clearResourcePacks()}.
  • The request is sent with empty string as the hash when the hash is not provided. This might result in newer versions not loading the pack correctly.

methods.desc:
Request that the player's client download and include another resource pack.

The player's client will download the new resource pack asynchronously in the background, and will automatically add to it once the download is complete. If the client has downloaded and cached a resource pack with the same hash in the past it will not download but directly apply the cached pack. If the hash is null and the client has downloaded and cached the same resource pack in the past, it will perform a file size check against the response content to determine if the resource pack has changed and needs to be downloaded again. When this request is sent for the very first time from a given server, the client will first display a confirmation GUI to the player before proceeding with the download.

Notes:

  • Players can disable server resources on their client, in which case this method will have no affect on them. Use the {@link PlayerResourcePackStatusEvent} to figure out whether or not the player loaded the pack!
  • To remove a resource pack you can use {@link #removeResourcePack(UUID)} or {@link #removeResourcePacks()}.
  • The request is sent with empty string as the hash when the hash is not provided. This might result in newer versions not loading the pack correctly.

the border to set, or null to set to the world border of

methods.name: sendHealthUpdate

params.name: health
params.desc: the health. If 0.0, the client will believe it is dead

methods.desc:
Send a health update to the player. This will adjust the health, food, and
saturation on the client and will not affect the player's actual values on
the server. As soon as any of these values change on the server, changes sent
by this method will no longer be visible.

methods.name: sendHealthUpdate
methods.desc:
Send a health update to the player using its known server values. This will
synchronize the health, food, and saturation on the client and therefore may
be useful when changing a player's maximum health attribute.

methods.name: isHealthScaled
methods.desc:
Gets if the client is displayed a 'scaled' health, that is, health on a
scale from 0-{@link #getHealthScale()}.
methods.ret: if client health display is scaled

methods.name: setHealthScaled

params.name: scale
params.desc: if the client health display is scaled

methods.desc:
Sets if the client is displayed a 'scaled' health, that is, health on a scale from 0-{@link #getHealthScale()}.

Displayed health follows a simple formula displayedHealth = getHealth() / getMaxHealth() * getHealthScale().

methods.name: setHealthScale

params.name: scale
params.desc: the number to scale health to

methods.desc:
Sets the number to scale health to for the client; this will also {@link #setHealthScaled(boolean) setHealthScaled(true)}.

Displayed health follows a simple formula displayedHealth = getHealth() / getMaxHealth() * getHealthScale().

methods.name: getHealthScale
methods.desc: Gets the number that health is scaled to for the client.
methods.ret:
the number that health would be scaled to for the client if
    HealthScaling is set to true

methods.name: getSpectatorTarget
methods.desc:
Gets the entity which is followed by the camera when in
{@link GameMode#SPECTATOR}.
methods.ret:
the followed entity, or null if not in spectator mode or not
following a specific entity.

methods.name: setSpectatorTarget

params.name: entity
params.desc: the entity to follow or null to reset

methods.desc:
Sets the entity which is followed by the camera when in
{@link GameMode#SPECTATOR}.

methods.name: sendTitle
methods.desc:
Sends a title and a subtitle message to the player. If either of these
values are null, they will not be sent and the display will remain
unchanged. If they are empty strings, the display will be updated as
such. If the strings contain a new line, only the first line will be
sent. The titles will be displayed with the client's default timings.

methods.name: sendTitle

params.name: fadeIn
params.desc: time in ticks for titles to fade in. Defaults to 10.

params.name: stay
params.desc: time in ticks for titles to stay. Defaults to 70.

params.name: fadeOut
params.desc: time in ticks for titles to fade out. Defaults to 20.

methods.desc:
Sends a title and a subtitle message to the player. If either of these
values are null, they will not be sent and the display will remain
unchanged. If they are empty strings, the display will be updated as
such. If the strings contain a new line, only the first line will be
sent. All timings values may take a value of -1 to indicate that they
will use the last value sent (or the defaults if no title has been
displayed).

methods.name: resetTitle
methods.desc:
Resets the title displayed to the player. This will clear the displayed
title / subtitle and reset timings to their default values.

methods.name: getAdvancementProgress
methods.desc: Return the player's progression on the specified advancement.

methods.name: getClientViewDistance
methods.desc:
Get the player's current client side view distance.
Will default to the server view distance if the client has not yet communicated this information,

methods.name: locale
methods.desc: Gets the player's current locale.

methods.name: getPing
methods.desc: Gets the player's estimated ping in milliseconds. In Vanilla this value represents a weighted average of the response time to application layer ping packets sent. This value does not represent the network round trip time and as such may have less granularity and be impacted by other sources. For these reasons it should not be used for anti-cheat purposes. Its recommended use is only as a qualitative indicator of connection quality (Vanilla uses it for this purpose in the tab list).

methods.name: getLocale
methods.desc:
Gets the player's current locale. The value of the locale String is not defined properly.
The vanilla Minecraft client will use lowercase language / country pairs separated by an underscore, but custom resource packs may use any format they wish.

methods.name: getAffectsSpawning
methods.desc: Get whether the player can affect mob spawning
methods.ret: if the player can affect mob spawning

methods.name: setAffectsSpawning

params.name: affects
params.desc: Whether the player can affect mob spawning

methods.desc: Set whether the player can affect mob spawning

methods.desc: Gets the view distance for this player

methods.name: getSimulationDistance
methods.desc: Gets the simulation distance for this player

methods.name: setSimulationDistance
methods.desc: Sets the simulation distance for this player

methods.name: getNoTickViewDistance
methods.desc:
Gets the no-ticking view distance for this player.

No-tick view distance is the view distance where chunks will load, however the chunks and their entities will not be set to tick.
methods.ret: The no-tick view distance for this player.

methods.name: setNoTickViewDistance
methods.desc:
Sets the no-ticking view distance for this player.

No-tick view distance is the view distance where chunks will load, however the chunks and their entities will not be set to tick.

methods.name: getSendViewDistance
methods.desc:
Gets the sending view distance for this player.

Sending view distance is the view distance where chunks will load in for players.
methods.ret: The sending view distance for this player.

methods.name: setSendViewDistance
methods.desc:
Sets the sending view distance for this player.

Sending view distance is the view distance where chunks will load in for players.

methods.name: updateCommands
methods.desc:
Update the list of commands sent to the client.
Generally useful to ensure the client has a complete list of commands after permission changes are done.

methods.name: openBook

params.name: book
params.desc: The book to open for this player

methods.desc: Open a {@link Material#WRITTEN_BOOK} for a Player

methods.name: openSign
methods.desc:
Open a Sign for editing by the Player.

The Sign must be in the same world as the player.

methods.name: openSign
methods.desc:
Open a Sign for editing by the Player.

The Sign must be placed in the same world as the player.

methods.name: showDemoScreen
methods.desc:
Shows the demo screen to the player, this screen is normally only seen in the demo version of the game.
Servers can modify the text on this screen using a resource pack.

methods.name: isAllowingServerListings
methods.desc: Gets whether the player has the "Allow Server Listings" setting enabled.
methods.ret: whether the player allows server listings

methods.name: getPlayerProfile
methods.desc: Gets a copy of this players profile

methods.name: setPlayerProfile
methods.desc:
Changes the PlayerProfile for this player. This will cause this player to be re-registered to all clients that can currently see this player.

After executing this method, the player {@link java.util.UUID} won't be swapped, only their name and profile properties.

methods.name: getCooldownPeriod
methods.desc: Returns the amount of ticks the current cooldown lasts
methods.ret: Amount of ticks cooldown will last

params.name: adjustTicks
params.desc: Amount of ticks to add to cooldown counter for this calculation

methods.desc: Returns the percentage of attack power available based on the cooldown (zero to one).

methods.name: resetCooldown
methods.desc: Reset the cooldown counter to 0, effectively starting the cooldown period.

Boost a Player that's {@link #isGliding()} using a {@link Firework}.
If the creation of the entity is cancelled, no boosting is done.
This method does not fire {@link com.destroystokyo.paper.event.player.PlayerElytraBoostEvent}.
methods.ret: The {@link Firework} boosting the Player or null if the spawning of the entity was cancelled

methods.name: sendOpLevel

params.name: level
params.desc: The level to send to the player. Must be in {@code [0, 4]}.

methods.desc:
Send a packet to the player indicating its operator status level.

Note: This will not persist across more than the current connection, and setting the player's operator status as a later point will override the effects of this.

methods.name: addAdditionalChatCompletions
methods.desc:
Adds custom chat completion suggestions that the client will
suggest when typing in chat.

methods.name: removeAdditionalChatCompletions
methods.desc:
Removes custom chat completion suggestions that the client
suggests when typing in chat.

Note: this only applies to previously added custom completions,
online player names are always suggested and cannot be removed.

methods.name: getClientBrandName
methods.desc:
Returns player's client brand name. If the client didn't send this information, the brand name will be null.
For the Notchian client this name defaults to vanilla. Some modified clients report other names such as forge.

methods.name: getMinWaitTime

The default is 100 ticks (5 seconds).

methods.desc:
Get the minimum number of ticks one has to wait for a fish to bite after appearing.

The default is 20 ticks (1 second).
Lure does not affect this value. This will also effect the radius (0.1 * lureTime) of where the fish will appear.

to bite

The default is 20 ticks (1 second).
Lure does not affect this value. This will also effect the radius (0.1 * lureTime) of where the fish will appear.

methods.name: getMaxLureTime
methods.desc:
Get the maximum number of ticks one has to wait for a fish to bite after appearing.

The default is 80 ticks (4 second).
Lure does not affect this value. This will also effect the radius (0.1 * lureTime) of where the fish will appear.
methods.ret: Maximum number of ticks one has to wait for a fish to bite

params.desc: maximum ticks to wait for a bite

Sets how many ticks the ravager is roaring for.
While roaring, the ravager cannot move
This will tick down till it gets to -1, where it is no longer active.
If set to 11, this will play a sound and hurt nearby players.

methods.name: hasCooldown
methods.desc: Check whether a cooldown is active on the specified material.
methods.ret: if a cooldown is active on the material

methods.name: getCooldown
methods.desc: Get the cooldown time in ticks remaining for the specified material.
methods.ret: the remaining cooldown time in ticks

methods.name: setCooldown

params.name: material
params.desc: the material to set the cooldown for

params.name: ticks
params.desc: the amount of ticks to set or 0 to remove

methods.desc:
Set a cooldown on the specified material for a certain amount of ticks. ticks. 0 ticks will result in the removal of the cooldown.

Cooldowns are used by the server for items such as ender pearls and shields to prevent them from being used repeatedly.

Note that cooldowns will not by themselves stop an item from being used for attacking.

is still valid.

whether to try and sleep at the location even if not
normally possible

Attempts to make the entity sleep at the given location.
The location must be in the current world and have a bed placed at the location. The game may also enforce other requirements such as proximity to bed, monsters, and dimension type if force is not set.

If there is an Entity on this entities left shoulder, it will be released to the world and returned.
If no Entity is released, null will be returned.

methods.desc:
If there is an Entity on this entities left shoulder, it will be released to the world and returned.
If no Entity is released, null will be returned.

methods.desc:
Gets the current cooldown for a player's attack.

This is used to calculate damage, with 1.0 representing a fully charged
attack and 0.0 representing a non-charged attack
methods.ret: A float between 0.0-1.0 representing the progress of the charge

methods.name: discoverRecipe

params.name: recipe
params.desc: the key of the recipe to discover

methods.desc:
Discover a recipe for this player such that it has not already been
discovered. This method will add the key's associated recipe to the
player's recipe book.
methods.ret: whether or not the recipe was newly discovered

methods.name: discoverRecipes

params.name: recipes
params.desc: the keys of the recipes to discover

methods.desc:
Discover a collection of recipes for this player such that they have not
already been discovered. This method will add the keys' associated
recipes to the player's recipe book. If a recipe in the provided
collection has already been discovered, it will be silently ignored.

methods.name: undiscoverRecipe

params.name: recipe
params.desc: the key of the recipe to undiscover

methods.desc:
Undiscover a recipe for this player such that it has already been
discovered. This method will remove the key's associated recipe from the
player's recipe book.
methods.ret:
whether or not the recipe was successfully undiscovered (i.e. it
was previously discovered)

methods.name: undiscoverRecipes

params.name: recipes
params.desc: the keys of the recipes to undiscover

methods.desc:
Undiscover a collection of recipes for this player such that they have
already been discovered. This method will remove the keys' associated
recipes from the player's recipe book. If a recipe in the provided
collection has not yet been discovered, it will be silently ignored.
methods.ret:
the amount of undiscovered recipes where 0 indicates that none
were undiscovered and a number equal to {@code recipes.size()} indicates
that all were undiscovered

methods.name: hasDiscoveredRecipe

params.name: recipe
params.desc: the key of the recipe to check

methods.desc: Check whether or not this entity has discovered the specified recipe.

methods.name: getDiscoveredRecipes
methods.desc: Get an immutable set of recipes this entity has discovered.

methods.name: getShoulderEntityLeft

Gets the entity currently perched on the left shoulder or null if no entity.
The returned entity will not be spawned within the world, so most operations are invalid unless the entity is first spawned in.

methods.name: setShoulderEntityLeft
methods.desc:
Sets the entity currently perched on the left shoulder, or null to remove. This method will remove the entity from the world.
Note that only a copy of the entity will be set to display on the shoulder.
Also note that the client will currently only render {@link Parrot} entities.

methods.name: getShoulderEntityRight
methods.desc:
Gets the entity currently perched on the right shoulder or null if no entity.
The returned entity will not be spawned within the world, so most operations are invalid unless the entity is first spawned in.

methods.name: setShoulderEntityRight
methods.desc:
Sets the entity currently perched on the right shoulder, or null to remove. This method will remove the entity from the world.
Note that only a copy of the entity will be set to display on the shoulder.
Also note that the client will currently only render {@link Parrot} entities.

Exhaustion controls how fast the food level drops. While you have a certain amount of exhaustion, your saturation will drop to zero, and then your food will drop to zero.

the HumanEntity when they have saturation and
their food level is {@literal >=} 20. Default is 10.
Not affected if the world's difficulty is peaceful.

the HumanEntity when they have no saturation and
their food level is {@literal >=} 18. Default is 80.

methods.desc:
Get the regeneration rate (1 health per x ticks) of
the HumanEntity when they have no saturation and
their food level is {@literal >=} 18. Default is 80.

Get the starvation rate (1 health per x ticks) of
the HumanEntity. Default is 80.

be boosted

methods.desc:
Gets the amount of ticks until this entity will be converted to a

When this reaches 300, the entity will be converted.

methods.name: setConversionTime
methods.desc:
Sets the conversion counter value. The counter is incremented
every tick the method {@link #isConverting()} returns true. Setting
this value will not start the conversion if the {@link PiglinAbstract} is
not in a valid environment ({@link org.bukkit.World#isPiglinSafe})
to convert, is immune to zombification ({@link #isImmuneToZombification()})
or has no AI ({@link #hasAI}).

When this reaches 300, the entity will be converted. To stop the
conversion use {@link #setImmuneToZombification(boolean)}.

methods.ret: the current block offset for this minecart.

methods.name: getMinecartMaterial
methods.desc: Gets the {@link Material} that represents this Minecart type.

desc: Represents a minecart entity.
Represents Llama spit.

methods.name: getLocation
methods.desc: Gets the entity's current position
methods.ret: a new copy of Location containing the position of this entity

methods.name: getLocation
methods.desc:
Stores the entity's current position in the provided Location object.

If the provided Location is null this method does nothing and returns null.
methods.ret: The Location object provided or null

methods.name: setVelocity

methods.name: getVelocity

methods.ret: Current traveling velocity of this entity

methods.name: getHeight

methods.name: getWidth

methods.name: getBoundingBox
methods.desc:
Gets the entity's current bounding box.

The returned bounding box reflects the entity's current location and size.

methods.name: isOnGround
methods.desc:
Returns true if the entity is supported by a block. This value is a
state updated by the server and is not recalculated unless the entity
moves.
methods.ret: True if entity is on ground.

methods.name: isInWater
methods.desc: Returns true if the entity is in water.
methods.ret: true if the entity is in water.

methods.name: getWorld
methods.desc: Gets the current world this entity resides in

methods.name: setRotation
methods.desc:
Sets the entity's rotation.

Note that if the entity is affected by AI, it may override this rotation.

methods.name: teleport

params.name: location
params.desc: New location to teleport this entity to

params.name: teleportFlags
params.desc: Flags to be used in this teleportation

methods.desc: Teleports this entity to the given location.

params.name: location
params.desc: New location to teleport this entity to

params.name: teleportFlags
params.desc: Flags to be used in this teleportation

methods.desc: Teleports this entity to the given location.

methods.name: teleport

params.name: location
params.desc: New location to teleport this entity to

methods.desc:
Teleports this entity to the given location. If this entity is riding a
vehicle, it will be dismounted prior to teleportation.

methods.name: teleport

params.name: location
params.desc: New location to teleport this entity to

methods.desc:
Teleports this entity to the given location. If this entity is riding a
vehicle, it will be dismounted prior to teleportation.

methods.name: teleport

params.name: destination
params.desc: Entity to teleport this entity to

methods.desc:
Teleports this entity to the target Entity. If this entity is riding a
vehicle, it will be dismounted prior to teleportation.

params.desc: Entity to teleport this entity to

methods.desc:
Teleports this entity to the target Entity. If this entity is riding a
vehicle, it will be dismounted prior to teleportation.

methods.name: teleportAsync
methods.desc: Loads/Generates(in 1.13+) the Chunk asynchronously, and then teleports the entity when the chunk is ready.
methods.ret: A future that will be completed with the result of the teleport

methods.name: getNearbyEntities

params.name: x
params.desc: 1/2 the size of the box along x axis

params.name: y
params.desc: 1/2 the size of the box along y axis

params.name: z
params.desc: 1/2 the size of the box along z axis

methods.desc:
Returns a list of entities within a bounding box centered around this
entity

methods.name: getEntityId
methods.desc: Returns a unique id for this entity

methods.name: getFireTicks
methods.desc:
Returns the entity's current fire ticks (ticks before the entity stops
being on fire).

methods.name: getMaxFireTicks
methods.desc: Returns the entity's maximum fire ticks.

methods.name: setFireTicks
methods.desc:
Sets the entity's current fire ticks (ticks before the entity stops
being on fire).

methods.name: setVisualFire
methods.desc: Sets if the entity has visual fire (it will always appear to be on fire).

methods.name: isVisualFire
methods.desc: Gets if the entity has visual fire (it will always appear to be on fire).

methods.name: getFreezeTicks
methods.desc:
Returns the entity's current freeze ticks (amount of ticks the entity has
been in powdered snow).

methods.name: getMaxFreezeTicks
methods.desc:
Returns the entity's maximum freeze ticks (amount of ticks before it will
be fully frozen)

methods.name: setFreezeTicks
methods.desc:
Sets the entity's current freeze ticks (amount of ticks the entity has
been in powdered snow).

methods.name: isFrozen
methods.desc:
Gets if the entity is fully frozen (it has been in powdered snow for max
freeze ticks).

methods.name: setNoPhysics

params.name: noPhysics
params.desc: boolean indicating if the entity should not have physics.

methods.desc: Sets this entities no physics status.

methods.name: hasNoPhysics
methods.desc: Gets if this entity has no physics.
methods.ret: true if the entity does not have physics.

methods.name: isFreezeTickingLocked
methods.desc:
Gets if the entity currently has its freeze ticks locked to a set amount.

This is only set by plugins

methods.name: lockFreezeTicks
methods.desc:
Sets if the entity currently has its freeze ticks locked,
preventing default vanilla freeze tick modification.

methods.name: remove
methods.desc: Mark the entity's removal.

methods.name: isDead
methods.desc: Returns true if this entity has been marked for removal.

methods.name: isValid
methods.desc:
Returns false if the entity has died, been despawned for some other
reason, or has not been added to the world.

methods.name: getServer
methods.desc: Gets the {@link Server} that contains this Entity

methods.name: isPersistent
methods.desc:
Returns true if the entity gets persisted.

By default all entities are persistent. An entity will also not get persisted, if it is riding an entity that is not persistent.

The persistent flag on players controls whether or not to save their playerdata file when they quit. If a player is directly or indirectly riding a non-persistent entity, the vehicle at the root and all its passengers won't get persisted.

This should not be confused with {@link LivingEntity#setRemoveWhenFarAway(boolean)} which controls despawning of living entities.
methods.ret: true if this entity is persistent

methods.name: setPersistent
methods.desc: Sets whether or not the entity gets persisted.

methods.name: getPassenger
methods.desc:
Gets the primary passenger of a vehicle. For vehicles that could have
multiple passengers, this will only return the primary passenger.

methods.name: setPassenger
methods.desc: Set the passenger of a vehicle.
methods.ret: false if it could not be done for whatever reason

methods.name: getPassengers
methods.desc:
Gets a list of passengers of this vehicle.

The returned list will not be directly linked to the entity's current passengers, and no guarantees are made as to its mutability.
methods.ret: list of entities corresponding to current passengers.

methods.name: addPassenger
methods.desc: Add a passenger to the vehicle.
methods.ret: false if it could not be done for whatever reason

methods.name: removePassenger
methods.desc: Remove a passenger from the vehicle.
methods.ret: false if it could not be done for whatever reason

methods.name: isEmpty
methods.desc: Check if a vehicle has passengers.
methods.ret: True if the vehicle has no passengers.

methods.name: eject
methods.desc: Eject any passenger.
methods.ret: True if there was a passenger.

methods.name: getFallDistance
methods.desc: Returns the distance this entity has fallen

methods.name: setFallDistance
methods.desc: Sets the fall distance for this entity

methods.name: setLastDamageCause
methods.desc: Record the last {@link EntityDamageEvent} inflicted on this entity

methods.name: getLastDamageCause
methods.desc:
Retrieve the last {@link EntityDamageEvent} inflicted on this entity.
This event may have been cancelled.
methods.ret:
the last known {@link EntityDamageEvent} or null if hitherto
    unharmed

methods.name: getUniqueId
methods.desc: Returns a unique and persistent id for this entity

methods.name: getTicksLived
methods.desc:
Gets the amount of ticks this entity has lived for.

This is the equivalent to "age" in entities.

methods.name: setTicksLived
methods.desc:
Sets the amount of ticks this entity has lived for.

This is the equivalent to "age" in entities. May not be less than one tick.

methods.name: playEffect
methods.desc:
Performs the specified {@link EntityEffect} for this entity.

This will be viewable to all players near the entity.

If the effect is not applicable to this class of entity, it will not play.

methods.name: getType
methods.desc: Get the type of the entity.

methods.name: getSwimSound
methods.desc: Get the {@link Sound} this entity makes while swimming.

methods.name: getSwimSplashSound
methods.desc:
Get the {@link Sound} this entity makes when splashing in water. For most
entities, this is just {@link Sound#ENTITY_GENERIC_SPLASH}.

methods.name: getSwimHighSpeedSplashSound
methods.desc:
Get the {@link Sound} this entity makes when splashing in water at high
speeds. For most entities, this is just {@link Sound#ENTITY_GENERIC_SPLASH}.

methods.name: isInsideVehicle
methods.desc: Returns whether this entity is inside a vehicle.
methods.ret: True if the entity is in a vehicle.

methods.name: leaveVehicle
methods.desc:
Leave the current vehicle. If the entity is currently in a vehicle (and
is removed from it), true will be returned, otherwise false will be
returned.
methods.ret: True if the entity was in a vehicle.

methods.name: getVehicle
methods.desc:
Get the vehicle that this entity is inside. If there is no vehicle,
null will be returned.

methods.name: setCustomNameVisible
methods.desc:
Sets whether or not to display the mob's custom name client side. The name will be displayed above the mob similarly to a player.

This value has no effect on players, they will always display their name.

methods.name: isCustomNameVisible
methods.desc:
Gets whether or not the mob's custom name is displayed client side.

This value has no effect on players, they will always display their name.
methods.ret: if the custom name is displayed

methods.name: setVisibleByDefault
methods.desc:
Sets whether or not this entity is visible by default.

If this entity is not visible by default, then
{@link Player#showEntity(org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin, org.bukkit.entity.Entity)}
will need to be called before the entity is visible to a given player.

methods.name: isVisibleByDefault
methods.desc:
Gets whether or not this entity is visible by default.

If this entity is not visible by default, then
{@link Player#showEntity(org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin, org.bukkit.entity.Entity)}
will need to be called before the entity is visible to a given player.

methods.name: getTrackedBy
methods.desc:
Get all players that are currently tracking this entity.

'Tracking' means that this entity has been sent to the player and that they are receiving updates on its state. Note that the client's {@code 'Entity Distance'} setting does not affect the range at which entities are tracked.
methods.ret: the players tracking this entity, or an empty set if none

methods.name: setGlowing
methods.desc: Sets whether the entity has a team colored (default: white) glow. nb: this refers to the 'Glowing' entity property, not whether a glowing potion effect is applied

methods.name: isGlowing
methods.desc: Gets whether the entity is glowing or not. nb: this refers to the 'Glowing' entity property, not whether a glowing potion effect is applied

methods.name: setInvulnerable
methods.desc:
Sets whether the entity is invulnerable or not.

When an entity is invulnerable it can only be damaged by players in creative mode.

methods.name: isInvulnerable
methods.desc: Gets whether the entity is invulnerable or not.

methods.name: isSilent
methods.desc: Gets whether the entity is silent or not.

methods.name: setSilent
methods.desc:
Sets whether the entity is silent or not.

When an entity is silent it will not produce any sound.

methods.name: hasGravity
methods.desc: Returns whether gravity applies to this entity.

methods.name: setGravity
methods.desc: Sets whether gravity applies to this entity.

methods.name: getPortalCooldown
methods.desc: Gets the period of time (in ticks) before this entity can use a portal.

methods.name: setPortalCooldown
methods.desc: Sets the period of time (in ticks) before this entity can use a portal.

methods.name: getScoreboardTags
methods.desc:
Returns a set of tags for this entity.
Entities can have no more than 1024 tags.
methods.ret: a set of tags for this entity

methods.name: addScoreboardTag
methods.desc:
Add a tag to this entity.
Entities can have no more than 1024 tags.
methods.ret: true if the tag was successfully added

methods.name: removeScoreboardTag
methods.desc: Removes a given tag from this entity.
methods.ret: true if the tag was successfully removed

methods.name: getPistonMoveReaction
methods.desc: Returns the reaction of the entity when moved by a piston.

methods.name: getFacing
methods.desc:
Get the closest cardinal {@link BlockFace} direction an entity is currently facing.
This will not return any non-cardinal directions such as {@link BlockFace#UP} or {@link BlockFace#DOWN}.
{@link Hanging} entities will override this call and thus their behavior may be different.

methods.name: getPose
methods.desc: Gets the entity's current pose. Note that the pose is only updated at the end of a tick, so may be inconsistent with other methods. eg {@link Player#isSneaking()} being true does not imply the current pose will be {@link Pose#SNEAKING}

methods.name: isSneaking
methods.desc: Returns if the entity is in sneak mode
methods.ret: true if the entity is in sneak mode

methods.name: setSneaking

params.name: sneak
params.desc: true if the entity should be sneaking

methods.desc:
Sets the sneak mode the entity.

Note: For most Entities this does not update Entity's pose and just makes its name tag less visible.

methods.name: setPose
methods.desc:
Sets the entity's current {@link Pose}.

Note: While poses affect some things like hitboxes, they do not change the entity's state (e.g. having {@link Pose#SNEAKING} does not guarantee {@link #isSneaking()} being {@code true}).

If applied to the {@link Player}, they might see a different pose client-side.

methods.name: setPose

params.name: fixed
params.desc: whether the new {@link Pose} should stay until manually changed

methods.desc:
Sets the entity's current {@link Pose}.

Note: While poses affect some things like hitboxes, they do not change the entity's state (e.g. having {@link Pose#SNEAKING} does not guarantee {@link #isSneaking()} being {@code true}).

If applied to the {@link Player}, they might see a different pose client-side.

methods.name: hasFixedPose
methods.desc: Checks whether the entity has a fixed {@link Pose}
methods.ret: whether the entity has a fixed {@link Pose}

methods.name: getSpawnCategory
methods.desc: Get the category of spawn to which this entity belongs.

methods.name: isInWorld
methods.desc:
Checks if this entity has been spawned in a world.
Entities not spawned in a world will not tick, be sent to players, or be saved to the server files.
methods.ret: whether the entity has been spawned in a world

methods.name: createSnapshot
methods.desc: Crates an {@link EntitySnapshot} representing the current state of this entity.
methods.ret: a snapshot representing this entity or null if one cannot be made

methods.name: copy
methods.desc:
Creates a copy of this entity and all its data. Does not spawn the copy in the world.
Note: Players cannot be copied.

methods.name: copy
methods.desc:
Creates a copy of this entity and all its data. Spawns the copy at the given location.
Note: Players cannot be copied.

methods.name: teamDisplayName
methods.desc:
Gets the entity's display name formatted with their team prefix/suffix and
the entity's default hover/click events.

methods.name: getOrigin
methods.desc:
Gets the location where this entity originates from.

This value can be null if the entity hasn't yet been added to the world.
methods.ret: Location where entity originates or null if not yet added

methods.name: fromMobSpawner
methods.desc: Returns whether this entity was spawned from a mob spawner.
methods.ret: True if entity spawned from a mob spawner

methods.name: getChunk
methods.desc: Gets the latest chunk an entity is currently or was in.
methods.ret: The current, or most recent chunk if the entity is invalid (which may load the chunk)

methods.name: getEntitySpawnReason
methods.ret: The {@link org.bukkit.event.entity.CreatureSpawnEvent.SpawnReason} that initially spawned this entity. <!-- Paper - added "initially" to clarify that the SpawnReason doesn't change after the Entity was initially spawned" -->

methods.name: isUnderWater
methods.desc: Check if entity is underwater

methods.name: isInRain
methods.desc: Check if entity is in rain

methods.name: isInBubbleColumn
methods.desc: Check if entity is in bubble column

methods.name: isInWaterOrRain
methods.desc: Check if entity is in water or rain

methods.name: isInWaterOrBubbleColumn
methods.desc: Check if entity is in water or bubble column

methods.name: isInWaterOrRainOrBubbleColumn
methods.desc: Check if entity is in water or rain or bubble column

methods.name: isInLava
methods.desc: Check if entity is in lava

methods.name: isTicking
methods.desc: Check if entity is inside a ticking chunk

methods.name: getTrackedPlayers
methods.desc: Returns a set of {@link Player Players} within this entity's tracking range (players that can "see" this entity).

methods.name: spawnAt

params.name: location
params.desc: The location to spawn the entity at.

methods.desc:
Spawns the entity in the world at the given {@link Location} with the default spawn reason.

This will not spawn the entity if the entity is already spawned or has previously been despawned.

Also, this method will fire the same events as a normal entity spawn.
methods.ret: Whether the entity was successfully spawned.

methods.name: spawnAt

params.name: location
params.desc: The location to spawn the entity at.

params.name: reason
params.desc: The reason for the entity being spawned.

methods.desc:
Spawns the entity in the world at the given {@link Location} with the reason given.

This will not spawn the entity if the entity is already spawned or has previously been despawned.

Also, this method will fire the same events as a normal entity spawn.
methods.ret: Whether the entity was successfully spawned.

methods.name: isInPowderedSnow
methods.desc: Check if entity is inside powdered snow.

methods.name: getX
methods.desc: Gets the x-coordinate of this entity

methods.name: getY
methods.desc: Gets the y-coordinate of this entity

methods.name: getZ
methods.desc: Gets the z-coordinate of this entity

methods.name: getPitch
methods.desc: Gets this entity's pitch

methods.name: getYaw
methods.desc: Gets this entity's yaw

methods.name: collidesAt

params.name: location
params.desc: the location to check collisions in

methods.desc:
Checks for any collisions with the entity's bounding box at the provided location.
This will check for any colliding entities (boats, shulkers) / worldborder / blocks.
Does not load chunks that are within the bounding box at the specified location.

methods.name: wouldCollideUsing

params.name: boundingBox
params.desc: the box to check collisions in

methods.desc:
This checks using the given boundingbox as the entity's boundingbox if the entity would collide with anything.
This will check for any colliding entities (boats, shulkers) / worldborder / blocks.
Does not load chunks that are within the bounding box.

methods.name: getScheduler
methods.desc:
Returns the task scheduler for this entity. The entity scheduler can be used to schedule tasks that are guaranteed to always execute on the tick thread that owns the entity.

If you do not need/want to make your plugin run on Folia, use {@link org.bukkit.Server#getScheduler()} instead.
methods.ret: the task scheduler for this entity.

methods.name: getScoreboardEntryName
methods.desc: Gets the string name of the entity used to track it in {@link org.bukkit.scoreboard.Scoreboard Scoreboards}.

desc:
Represents a base entity in the world

Not all methods are guaranteed to work/may have side effects when {@link #isInWorld()} is false.
Represents a large {@link Fireball}

methods.name: hasEffectsForNextStew
methods.desc:
Checks for the presence of custom potion effects to be applied to the
next suspicious stew received from milking this {@link MushroomCow}.
methods.ret: true if custom potion effects are applied to the stew

methods.name: getEffectsForNextStew
methods.desc:
Gets an immutable list containing all custom potion effects applied to the next suspicious stew received from milking this {@link MushroomCow}.

Plugins should check that hasCustomEffects() returns true before calling this method.
methods.ret: an immutable list of custom potion effects

methods.name: addEffectToNextStew

params.name: overwrite
params.desc:
true if any existing effect of the same type should be
overwritten

methods.desc:
Adds a custom potion effect to be applied to the next suspicious stew
received from milking this {@link MushroomCow}.
methods.ret:
true if the effects to be applied to the suspicious stew changed
as a result of this call

methods.name: addEffectToNextStew

params.name: suspiciousEffectEntry
params.desc: the suspicious effect entry to add

params.name: overwrite
params.desc:
true if any existing effect of the same type should be
overwritten

methods.desc:
Adds a suspicious effect entry to be applied to the next suspicious stew
received from milking this {@link MushroomCow}.
methods.ret:
true if the effects to be applied to the suspicious stew changed
as a result of this call

methods.name: removeEffectFromNextStew

params.name: type
params.desc: the potion effect type to remove

methods.desc:
Removes a custom potion effect from being applied to the next suspicious
stew received from milking this {@link MushroomCow}.
methods.ret:
true if the effects to be applied to the suspicious stew changed
as a result of this call

methods.name: hasEffectForNextStew

params.name: type
params.desc: the potion effect type to check for

methods.desc:
Checks for a specific custom potion effect type to be applied to the next
suspicious stew received from milking this {@link MushroomCow}.
methods.ret: true if the suspicious stew to be generated has this effect

methods.name: clearEffectsForNextStew
methods.desc:
Removes all custom potion effects to be applied to the next suspicious
stew received from milking this {@link MushroomCow}.

methods.name: getVariant
methods.desc: Get the variant of this cow.

methods.name: setVariant
methods.desc: Set the variant of this cow.

methods.name: getStewEffectDuration
methods.desc:
Gets how long the effect applied to stew
from this mushroom cow is.

methods.name: setStewEffectDuration
methods.desc:
Sets how long the effect applied to stew
from this mushroom cow is.

methods.name: getStewEffectType
methods.desc:
Gets the type of effect applied to stew
from this mushroom cow is.
methods.ret: effect type, or null if an effect is currently not set

methods.name: setStewEffect

params.name: type
params.desc:
new effect type
            or null if this cow does not give effects

methods.desc:
Sets the type of effect applied to stew
from this mushroom cow is.

methods.name: getStewEffects
methods.desc:
Returns an immutable collection of the effects applied to stew
items for this mushroom cow.

methods.name: setStewEffects
methods.desc: Sets effects applied to stew items for this mushroom cow.

desc: Represents a mushroom {@link Cow}

methods.name: getProfession
methods.desc: Gets the current profession of this villager.

methods.name: setProfession
methods.desc: Sets the new profession of this villager.

methods.name: getVillagerType
methods.desc: Gets the current type of this villager.

methods.name: setVillagerType
methods.desc: Sets the new type of this villager.

methods.name: getVillagerLevel
methods.desc:
Gets the level of this villager.

A villager with a level of 1 and no experience is liable to lose its
profession.

methods.name: setVillagerLevel
methods.desc:
Sets the level of this villager.

A villager with a level of 1 and no experience is liable to lose its
profession.

This doesn't update the trades of this villager.

methods.name: getVillagerExperience
methods.desc: Gets the trading experience of this villager.

methods.name: setVillagerExperience
methods.desc: Sets the trading experience of this villager.

methods.name: increaseLevel
methods.desc:
Increases the level of this villager. The villager will also unlock new recipes unlike the raw method {@link #setVillagerLevel(int)}.

A villager with a level of 1 and no experience is liable to lose its profession.

A master villager has a level of 5 in its profession and will unlock 10 trades (2 per level).

methods.name: addTrades

params.name: amount
params.desc: The amount of trades to give

methods.desc:
Gives to this villager some potential new trades
based to its profession and level.

methods.name: getRestocksToday
methods.desc: Gets the amount of times a villager has restocked their trades today

methods.name: setRestocksToday
methods.desc: Sets the amount of times a villager has restocked their trades today

methods.name: sleep
methods.desc:
Attempts to make this villager sleep at the given location.
The location must be in the current world and have a bed placed at the location. The villager will put its head on the specified block while sleeping.

methods.name: wakeup
methods.desc: Causes this villager to wake up if he's currently sleeping.

methods.name: shakeHead
methods.desc: Causes this villager to shake his head.

methods.name: zombify
methods.desc: Convert this Villager into a ZombieVillager as if it was killed by a Zombie. Note: this will fire a EntityTransformEvent
methods.ret:
the converted entity {@link ZombieVillager} or null if the
conversion its cancelled

methods.name: getReputation

params.name: uniqueId
params.desc: The {@link UUID} of the player to get the reputation of.

methods.desc:
Get the {@link com.destroystokyo.paper.entity.villager.Reputation reputation}
for a specific player by {@link UUID}.
methods.ret: The player's copied reputation with this villager.

methods.name: getReputations
methods.desc:
Get all {@link com.destroystokyo.paper.entity.villager.Reputation reputations}
for all players mapped by their {@link UUID unique IDs}.
methods.ret:
All {@link com.destroystokyo.paper.entity.villager.Reputation reputations} for all players
in a copied map.

methods.name: setReputation

params.name: uniqueId
params.desc: The {@link UUID} of the player to set the reputation of.

methods.desc:
Set the {@link com.destroystokyo.paper.entity.villager.Reputation reputation}
for a specific player by {@link UUID}.

methods.name: setReputations

params.name: reputations
params.desc:
All {@link com.destroystokyo.paper.entity.villager.Reputation reputations}
for all players mapped by their {@link UUID unique IDs}.

methods.desc:
Set all {@link com.destroystokyo.paper.entity.villager.Reputation reputations}
for all players mapped by their {@link UUID unique IDs}.

methods.name: clearReputations
methods.desc:
Clear all reputations from this villager. This removes every single
reputation regardless of its impact and the player associated.

desc: Represents a villager NPC

methods.name: getExperience
methods.desc: Gets how much experience is contained within this orb

methods.name: setExperience
methods.desc: Sets how much experience is contained within this orb

methods.name: isFromBottle
methods.desc: Check if this orb was spawned from a {@link ThrownExpBottle}
methods.ret: if orb was spawned from a bottle

methods.name: getTriggerEntityId
methods.desc:
If this experience orb was triggered to be spawned by
an entity such as a player, due to events such as killing entity,
breaking blocks, smelting in a furnace, etc, this will return the UUID
of the entity that triggered this orb to drop.

In the case of an entity being killed, this will be the killers UUID.
methods.ret: UUID of the player that triggered this orb to drop, or null if unknown/no triggering entity

methods.name: getSourceEntityId
methods.desc:
If this experience orb was spawned in relation to another
entity, such as a player or other living entity death, or breeding,
return the source entity UUID.

In the case of breeding, this will be the new baby entities UUID.
In the case of an entity being killed, this will be the dead entities UUID.

Gets the reason that this experience orb was spawned. For any case that we
do not know, such as orbs spawned before this API was added, UNKNOWN is returned.

This method will set the target of the {@link Head#CENTER center head} of the wither.

the entity targeted by the given head, or null if none is

methods.name: getInvulnerabilityTicks
methods.desc: Returns the wither's current invulnerability ticks.

methods.name: setInvulnerabilityTicks
methods.desc:
Sets the wither's current invulnerability ticks.

When invulnerability ticks reach 0, the wither will trigger an explosion.

methods.name: getInvulnerableTicks

methods.name: setInvulnerableTicks

params.name: ticks

methods.desc: Sets for how long in the future, the wither should be invulnerable.

params.desc: whether the wither can travel through portals

methods.desc: Sets whether the wither can travel through portals.

methods.desc:
Makes the wither invulnerable for 11 seconds and sets the health to one third of the max health.
This is called in vanilla directly after spawning the wither.

desc: Represents a Wither boss

methods.name: getVariant
methods.desc:
Gets the horse's variant.

A horse's variant defines its physical appearance and capabilities. Whether a horse is a regular horse, donkey, mule, or other kind of horse is determined using the variant.
methods.ret: a {@link Horse.Variant} representing the horse's variant

methods.name: getDomestication
methods.desc:
Gets the domestication level of this horse.

A higher domestication level indicates that the horse is closer to becoming tame. As the domestication level gets closer to the max domestication level, the chance of the horse becoming tame increases.

methods.name: setDomestication
methods.desc:
Sets the domestication level of this horse.

Setting the domestication level to a high value will increase the horse's chances of becoming tame.

Domestication level must be greater than zero and no greater than the max domestication level of the horse, determined with {@link #getMaxDomestication()}

methods.name: getMaxDomestication
methods.desc:
Gets the maximum domestication level of this horse.

The higher this level is, the longer it will likely take for the horse to be tamed.

methods.name: setMaxDomestication
methods.desc:
Sets the maximum domestication level of this horse.

Setting a higher max domestication will increase the amount of domesticating (feeding, riding, etc.) necessary in order to tame it, while setting a lower max value will have the opposite effect.

Maximum domestication must be greater than zero.

methods.name: getJumpStrength
methods.desc:
Gets the jump strength of this horse.

Jump strength defines how high the horse can jump. A higher jump strength increases how high a jump will go.

methods.name: setJumpStrength
methods.desc:
Sets the jump strength of this horse.

A higher jump strength increases how high a jump will go. Setting a jump strength to 0 will result in no jump. You cannot set a jump strength to a value below 0 or above 2.

methods.name: isEatingHaystack
methods.desc: Gets whether the horse is currently grazing hay.

methods.name: setEatingHaystack
methods.desc: Sets whether the horse is grazing hay.

methods.name: isEatingGrass
methods.desc: Gets if a horse is in their eating grass animation.

methods.name: setEatingGrass
methods.desc:
Sets if a horse is in their eating grass animation.

When true, the horse will lower its neck.

methods.name: isRearing
methods.desc: Gets if a horse is in their rearing animation.

methods.name: setRearing
methods.desc:
Sets if a horse is in their rearing animation.

When true, the horse will stand on its hind legs.

methods.name: isEating
methods.desc: Gets if a horse is in their eating animation.

methods.name: setEating
methods.desc:
Sets if a horse is in their eating animation.

When true, the horse will bob its head.

desc: Represents a Horse-like creature.
